title: Trump's Big Trip to Davos
summary: President Donald Trump is going to a big meeting in Davos, Switzerland, called the World Economic Forum. Before he even gets there, he has talked about wanting to buy Greenland and putting taxes on European countries. People are wondering if he will get a friendly welcome when he arrives. The article also talks about other news, like a soccer team from Morocco winning a game, threats to Iran, and events in Venezuela where the US is involved with oil and a leader named Maduro. It shows different views from people around the world on these topics.

keywords.explanation: a place in Switzerland where world leaders meet to talk about money and business
a big icy island that Trump wants to buy
taxes on things from other countries
a country in South America where there is trouble with its leader
a black liquid used for fuel that the US wants from Venezuela

questions.question: Where is President Trump going for a meeting?
What does Trump want to buy before the meeting?
What are tariffs?
options: Taxes on things from other countries
questions.correct_answer: Taxes on things from other countries

questions.question: Which country is mentioned for having trouble with its leader?
What does the US want from Venezuela?
Who won a soccer game in the article?

background_read: The World Economic Forum is a yearly meeting in Davos where leaders from many countries talk about how to make the world's economy better. President Trump is the leader of the United States and often says surprising things. Greenland is part of Denmark and is very cold. Venezuela is a country with a lot of oil, but it has problems with its government. Tariffs can make things more expensive when countries trade.
Article_Structure: WHO: President Donald Trump and other world leaders
WHAT: Trump is going to Davos and has talked about Greenland and tariffs, with other news about Iran and Venezuela
WHERE: Davos in Switzerland, and other places like Venezuela and Morocco
WHY: To see if Trump gets a warm welcome and to show different views on world events

perspectives.perspective: Some people might welcome Trump's actions
perspectives.description: They think he is strong and helps the US
They worry his plans could cause problems
